data.title: great and good service
data.text: we enjoy eating at Colletti's because the food is tasty and the is excellent. I recommend this place to anyone who likes Italian food with a nice ambiance.

data.title: Italian in the heart of downtown!
data.text: There were four of us and with drinks and entrees it was tight quarters on the table but other than that it was excellent The place is quite elegant, staff welcoming and attentive and we all enjoyer different menu selections.

data.title: Excellent Food and Service! Clean! Super-friendly!
data.text:
Had dinner here with a group of friends and was delighted by the whole experience. The restaurant decor is romantic and really beautiful. We parked at the side of this huge building downtown. It's obviously a well-kept building. The entrance, on 1st. Street, could be in any European local with it's beautiful cast-iron railings, flaming streetlamps, heavy linen canopies, and twinkling fairy lights. Gorgeous facade! We were greeted warmly by a young waitress and seated. The service was friendly and top-class. I ordered the minestrone soup and spagghetti bolognese. The soup was delicious. The vegetables were plentiful, fresh, and not soggy (overcooked). I'd ordered a cup, but found it to be very filling. My pasta sauce looked darker than traditional bolognese, but it was done to perfection! I cannot recommend this restaurant enough. It's a wonderful experience. And perfect for a romantic dinner. 

A big plus for me was the fact that we could have a conversation without straining to hear each other. 
We all enjoyed watching the young pizza-chef tossing the pizza dough. Brilliant fun!  This restaurant is spotlessly clean. And the staff are professional and friendly.

data.title: Family
data.text: Live music here once a month! Good jazz band and live comedy. This place is pricey but the food is good and service is wonderful! This is not a place to take you're children if they are bad and always act out!!! Please get a sitter!!!! No one wants their dinner ruined due to parents not controlling their children. They also have outside dinning as well. Great decor and they have pretty decent wine list. They also have wine tasting in Tuesday's can't wait to try. 😄

data.title: Terrible Service To The End
data.text: Our night at Colettis started bad and ended bad.  Service so bad at inception that we considered paying for our first round of drinks and leaving, but we gave them the benefit of the doubt.  Bad choice!! No bus service.  Incompetent wait staff.  Bad attitude.  We can deal with mediocre food with good customer service but mediocre food with such poor service resulted in a very disappointing experience.  Seven people in my group were equally disatisfied.  To top off our night, our ravioli to go was placed upside down in the to go container.  The top of the container (now the bottom) had four openings allowing the sauce to leak out.  It's just a matter of time before Collettis closes down and it will not be missed.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: We went to celebrate our anniversary while we were in town. Excellent food. I had the spaghetti with sausage. The salad was crisp and chilled. The wait staff was attentive without hovering. The restaurant is in an historic building. It's very nicely redone with a great atmosphere. We will definitely eat there again when we return in October

data.title: Table for four
data.text: I ate here with my wife and two additional friends. The waitress was delightful and the decoré/building are beautiful. I highly recommend this restaurant for a nice dinner.

data.title: Relaxing dinner with a great atmosphere, great friends and especially damn great food!!!!!
data.text: Best damn pizza I've had in a while great food, really great polite, courteous waiters and a great caring owner as always!!! Thanks Jo

data.title: Average food. Poorly trained staff.
data.text:
If you want a single glass of wine, you better like it out of a box.
The building is lovely, the food is expensive for what it is. I had a poppy seed spinach salad with grilled chicken. The spinach was wilted, I didn't see any poppy seeds, and the chicken was a few strips of tough chicken.
I want to like this place, but I rarely have a good meal there. Once I went for lunch and had a terrific burger with sweet potato fries, but dinners - pastas, salads, soups, etc. aren't good.

data.title: All show
data.text: Beautiful atmosphere, expensive menu, poor quality to food. Have been here multiple times and consistently been disappointed in food. Undercooked, soggy food. Attitude from staff when this issue was addressed. Not willing to even fix raw food. Skip this meal.

data.title: Great beef from Chicago
data.text: Service is fast and professional; appetizers abundant and freshly prepared. I had a sirloin filet cocked at perfection. It was very tasty and tender.

data.title: Food matches awesome welcome ;by owner
data.text: Mrs. Jo Wagner is always on site to insure you have a great experience. While the food is awesome I wish I could say the same about the service. The staff needs a dire training so their service matches the food and setting. I was literally stabbed on the arm with a bunch of forks by our clumsy waiter who also had no clue on how to serve. Since Harlingen sorely lacks fine restaurants we keep going back to the best place in town so far.

data.title: Poor.
data.text:
Super over rated. I know they tried to do the whole "upscale" thing, but they fall short. They use plastic bread baskets for the table. Besides that, the food isn't that good. We were under the impression it was "Italian". 
If you want good Italian food, go to stefanos.

data.title: Excellent upscale Itanian restaurant
data.text: An Excellent Italian restaurant if you are looking for a fancier meal. Prices are higher but service and food are as expected above valley standards. Their spaghetti had some of the best marinara sauce I have ever tried.

data.title: A Harlingen Treasure
data.text:
Joe the Owner of Colletti is an amazing woman. They have restored a Harlingen Landmark.
Chef Jesus has been there for 5 years and is one of the most creative and innovative I have seen.
The Wine List shows Great Support of Texas Wine. The service was perfect. If you are within 100 miles of Harlingen you must go.

data.title: Beautiful interior, excellent service and a wide ranging menu.
data.text: The interior of this restaurant is stunning.  Not at all what one expects - but it is a beautiful space.  Our dinner was excellent from start to finish.  The service was gracious and efficient.  Great, moderately priced wine list.  Highly recommend the Salmon, but the Pizzas looked great a well.

data.title: Brooklyn Pizza is our favorite
data.text: Two of us like to split the Brooklyn Pizza.  Always tasty, and plenty for two people!  We enjoy the ambiance and quiet atmosphere, plus their iced tea is really good!

data.title: It was nice
data.text: The ambience was great very romantic and just classy. The food was good as well better than olive garden.

data.title: Disgusting Fake Italian
data.text: Although the atmosphere is very nice as it is decorated very fancily, their cuisine is terrible! Their food is canned and fake! I was outraged at paying as much as I did for the meal I received. They carry themselves as if they run as 5 star high-end Italian restaurant when their food is nothing more than a jar of Chef Boyardee with a side of Tyson brand chicken that has been freezer burned. This place is overly priced. Nothing enrages me more than having to pay for low-quality food. Save yourself and go to Stefanos on Business 83. Not the same "fancy" atmosphere, but way better authentic food.

data.title: Average
data.text: Beautiful restaurant inside and out with a nice ambience. Service and food was average. I had the veal Parmesan and my wife had the chicken Parmesan. Dessert  was the highlight of the meal. I had the vanilla bean gelato and the wife had a cannoli which were both excellent choices.
